intro: Dioscorea tucumanensis, commonly known as the Tucumán yam, is a species of flowering plant in the family Dioscoreaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, and thrives in temperate climates. The plant produces tuberous roots that are used as a food source, similar to other members of the genus Dioscorea. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and typically white or greenish in color. The plant is valued both for its nutritional content and its role in traditional medicine.
